name: places/ChIJX8khoKYZ2jERhvzpOTCbmlU/reviews/ChZDSUhNMG9nS0VJQ0FnTURvbGRYbEtnEAE
text: {'text': 'Ample parking space in front of the coffeeshop. Very traditional settings. Quite busy in the morning peak especially during weekends. The curry puff is good. Hot and crispy. Would recommend to go along with traditional kaya butter toast bread. Coffee to me so so. The place is small. Family with prams would be a challenge. The staff may not be friendly but harmless. The prices there are really reasonable given now everything also increases. Coffee at $1.20, Toast less than $2. Curry puff also at $1.20 if not wrong.', 'languageCode': 'en'}

name: places/ChIJX8khoKYZ2jERhvzpOTCbmlU/reviews/ChZDSUhNMG9nS0VJQ0FnTURJbXVmZUlBEAE
places/ChIJX8khoKYZ2jERhvzpOTCbmlU/reviews/ChdDSUhNMG9nS0VJQ0FnTUNJLW9uTDZnRRAB
text:
{'text': "Really nothing to complain about. Feels authentic and not forced to be authentic. Prices were very reasonable ($4 a set).

Most surprising was the service. Not overly friendly, but more than what I would expect from a traditional kopitiam. As a foreigner, this was a relief.

The coffee itself was great, strong, made to order. The kaya toast was really good, fluffy, generous. Great bread. The eggs were standard.

It really is in a normal neighborhood, not some Cafe street. So the atmosphere felt nice and genuine. If you're in the neighborhood it's definitely worth a visit.", 'languageCode': 'en'}
originalText:

name: places/ChIJX8khoKYZ2jERhvzpOTCbmlU/reviews/ChZDSUhNMG9nS0VJQ0FnTUNZd0szUUlBEAE
text: {'text': '- it’s times like these when i regret not reading lower-rated reviews before going to try the food. most of what was said is spot on, with the environment being truly old school, dimly lit, the food being subpar and honestly not worth travelling for. the toast was really just okay, yes it is probably homemade and you can taste the looseness of it, but there is not much flavour to it. no strong flavour to the kaya too. butter was good though, and the butter coffee was decent. eggs whites were clumpy', 'languageCode': 'en'}

name: places/ChIJX8khoKYZ2jERhvzpOTCbmlU/reviews/ChZDSUhNMG9nS0VJQ0FnSURfdU1DeUdREAE
text: {'text': "There is fried curry puff in front of the store. One dollar for each, and I ordered a breakfast set in the shop, a cup of coffee, two slices of bread, and two half boiled eggs. The eggs were opened when served, can eat directly with some seasonings or eat bread together. The bread is baked on charcoal, which is crispy and the filling is a thick piece of butter and kaya sauce. The salty sweet taste and the crispy bread are very delicious. It's very traditional and full of nostalgic.", 'languageCode': 'en'}
